FuncDef: The reset chassis command resets a chassis.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies a chassis, which is represented in the form of chassis type+chassis ID.
The chassis ID is 1 or 2. A chassis example is CLC1 or CLC2.

Examples: Caution!!! Confirm to reset chassis clc1! Continue? [Y/N]:y
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
To reset a chassis in a virtual cluster system, run the reset chassis command.
Implementation Procedure
After the reset chassis command is run, the system prompts you whether to continue. If you enter Y, the specified chassis starts to be reset. If you enter N, the specified chassis is not reset.
Configuration Impact
After the reset chassis command is run, the specified chassis is reset and all boards in the chassis are also reset.
If chassis is not specified, the chassis on which the master main control board resides is reset. If the master and slave main control boards are located in the same chassis, the system is reset. If the master and slave main control boards are located in two chassis, a master/slave main control board switchover is performed.
Precautions
In VS mode, this command is supported only by the admin VS.
Before resetting a chassis, back up important data on the chassis.
